page.title: 06Ashleigh, Domesday Manor
page.content: Former estate Baron de Ashleigh records last Exeter blitz World War 2. Manor farm , Blatchford family here for 105 years. Sole occupant retired farmer, grandson farms. Two grouped adjoining farmhouses, one for workman, one empty. Wooden bungalow for let. Beef sheep and arable. Farmland grass semi-intensive. 10% arable. 30 acres corn 1985. Lost old granary in a barn fire 1983. Own water from borehole - yard and houses. Springs for fields. Shops Lifton, but uses travelling services. Butcher, green grocer, baker. Uses Lifton Post Office. Enjoys TV politics, current affairs. Today's politicians a poor lot. The farm cottage has housed a workman for 44 years,his wife is the housekeeper.They have 3 children,factory worker, shop assistant & cook. They like the isolation & independence.
